channel.title: cart on NGENUITY™ 3D Visualization System User Guide
channel.description: Recent content in cart on NGENUITY™ 3D Visualization System User Guide

item.title: System Components
item.description: At a minimum, the system includes the cart, camera, microscope, 3D glasses, keyboard, and touchpad. To optimize operation, incorporate additional devices such as the following: 1 System – Receives video from the camera and displays 3D images. 2 Patient Bed – Holds the patient at a comfortable level. 3 Microscope stand – Suspends a microscope above the patient. 4 Camera – Captures 3D video. 5 Microscope – Magnifies the view of the camera.

item.title: Cart
item.description: The cart receives video input from the camera and additional data from other connected devices, and then outputs the results on the monitor. 1 Primary Display – Produces 3840 x 2160p 3D resolution video. 3D images require passive, circularly-polarized 3D glasses. 2 Touchpad – Controls the cursor on the display. Another touchpad is also available on the wireless keyboard. 3 Front panel connectors – Includes 2 USB, an HDMI output, and a composite connector.

item.title: Shutdown Procedure
item.description: On the Home screen, click Power. Click Shut Down. Wait for the EPU indicators next to the USB connectors (see Cart) to turn off (~30 s). Turn off the power switch at the base of the cart.

item.title: Cleaning
item.description: Clean the system by periodically wiping down with a dry, lint-free cloth. Use warm water and mild detergent on non-electrical system components (for example, the cart, exterior cart panels, and 3D glasses). Wipe down the camera and camera cable with isopropyl alcohol. Wipe the display with a soft, dry cloth. Use less than 0.10 lb. of force on the display. Water-based cleaners may damage the coating on the screen. WARNING Only factory-authorized personnel should service the system or system components.

item.title: Cart (Communication Link with Centurion)
item.description: Frequency or frequency band of transmission: 2.405 GHz to 2.480 GHz Type and frequency characteristics of the modulation: OQPSK (Offset quadrature phase-shift keying) Effective Radiated Power (ERP): 11.3 dBm (13.40 mW)

item.title: Cart Wireless Certifications
item.description: United States FCC ID: RI7XE61 Australia: Brazil: Canada IC ID: 5131A-XE61 Japan: 209-J00129 Korea: MSIP-CRI-TCS-X61-24, R-R-Alc-NGEN Taiwan: CAAJ1LP2610T9

item.title: Label Locations
item.description: Note the safety and system label locations. Refer to the system for specific information. 1 Moving parts warning label – Includes a warning related to a protective guard. 2 Identifies compatible connectors. – The location and connector type varies with the display model. 3 Oculars storage warning label – Includes information about storing the microscope oculars. 4 Product label – Includes information about the system. 5 Wireless label – Indicates wireless capabilities.
